problem.tex: Let $\Omega$ be a region, $a\in\Omega$, and $r>0$ small enough that $\overline{B_r(a)}\subset\Omega$. Suppose that for all $z\in B_r(a), |f(z)|\leq M$. Then for all $n, |f^{(n)}(a)|\leq\frac{n!M}{r^n}$

solution.tex: The proof is just direct analysis on Cauchy's integral formula. \[|f^{(n)}(a)|=\left|\frac{n!}{2\pi i}\int_{\partial\overline{B_r(a)}}\frac{f(z)}{(z-a)^{n+1}}dz\right|\leq\frac{n!}{2\pi}\int_0^{2\pi}\frac{|f(a+re^{i\theta})|}{r^{n+1}}|ire^{i\theta}|d\theta.\] \[\leq\frac{n!}{2\pi r^n}\int_0^{2\pi}Md\theta=\frac{n!M}{r^n}\]I personally remember this proof better than the statement itself, what with what power should be on $r$ and stuff like that.
